keyword: how many calories is in a grilled cheese
title: How Many Calories in a Grilled Cheese?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a grilled cheese sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Grilled Cheese?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 slices cheddar cheese, 1 tbsp butter for grilling; standard preparation.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, cheese brand, butter amount, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical grilled cheese sandwich contains about 350 kcal, with 15 g protein and 20 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories is in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard version with white bread and cheddar.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a grilled cheese?
faqs.a: About 15 g protein, mainly from the cheese.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Around 20 g total fat, including 10 g saturated from cheese and butter.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Yes—whole wheat may reduce calories slightly compared to white bread.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Use low-fat cheese, less butter, or whole grain bread to cut 20–50 kcal.
